body: I simply cannot imagine having the massive temper tantrum as has happened here not result in bans. In fact, if this was any other website, this insanity would have been chucked into the bin two days ago or even a week ago. I applaud the admins for their astounding level of patience it has taken to attempt to reason with these, in all likelihood, teenagers who have never been disciplined before. Thank you for creating a great platform where all can say something, but not everyone has to listen!

body:
As someone who barely cares, the complaints seem valid enough to me.
It was obvious that a new centralized platform has no real way to end differently.

Reddit was founded by hard core libertarian free speech types, and one was arkancided for not selling out, the rest sold out for commie bank money. Reddit fought to be a place for free speech far longer than could have been expected, and normally the selling out to becoming a propaganda outlet happens, much sooner. Ruqqus is showing the signs that they are on that track, and its understandable why. The pressures are very high, and if you refuse to play ball you could seriously end up dead.

People who demand absolutely pure and unimpinged free speech will have to hop from place to place, until there is a suitable decentralized peer-to-peer forum system. And yes, it will no more be able to ban political wrong think than it will pirated content or illegal depraved porn types. 
We will end up there eventually; its just the nature of the tech. Cryptography and the internet are the fundamental winds here, and they are biased towards unstoppable free speech. Sooner or later it will win out, like entropy.

The day will come when the only filters will be the ones you choose to impose on your own. But ruqqus isnt going to be that, it cant be, because it is centralized. Because there are people who pay the bills, people who can be bought or killed.

body:
Honestly, I'm going to have to disagree with others here - the amount of tolerance we're seeing for dissent is pretty normal for a service of this size. Problem is, you're comparing it to things like YouTube, Twitter, or Reddit that have gone mainstream and "feedback" is no longer considered an important aspect as they're more interested in appealing to investor demands (which tends to run counter to user feedback).

Ruqqus is still at the size where it needs feedback and criticism to thrive. Almost every service this size tolerates it, or crumbles over a single controversial moment. And on that note, that little "BETA" is there to remind you that the site is figuring itself out, and I think should be taken as a request to voice your opinions. Its also why I'm critical of some of the exiles and kicks we've seen from official guilds.

Admittedly, what *isn't* normal for a service of this size is how divided the community is on feedback, to the point it feels like combating factions.

parent.body:
As someone who barely cares, the complaints seem valid enough to me.
It was obvious that a new centralized platform has no real way to end differently.

Reddit was founded by hard core libertarian free speech types, and one was arkancided for not selling out, the rest sold out for commie bank money. Reddit fought to be a place for free speech far longer than could have been expected, and normally the selling out to becoming a propaganda outlet happens, much sooner. Ruqqus is showing the signs that they are on that track, and its understandable why. The pressures are very high, and if you refuse to play ball you could seriously end up dead.

People who demand absolutely pure and unimpinged free speech will have to hop from place to place, until there is a suitable decentralized peer-to-peer forum system. And yes, it will no more be able to ban political wrong think than it will pirated content or illegal depraved porn types. 
We will end up there eventually; its just the nature of the tech. Cryptography and the internet are the fundamental winds here, and they are biased towards unstoppable free speech. Sooner or later it will win out, like entropy.

The day will come when the only filters will be the ones you choose to impose on your own. But ruqqus isnt going to be that, it cant be, because it is centralized. Because there are people who pay the bills, people who can be bought or killed.

parent.body:
Honestly, I'm going to have to disagree with others here - the amount of tolerance we're seeing for dissent is pretty normal for a service of this size. Problem is, you're comparing it to things like YouTube, Twitter, or Reddit that have gone mainstream and "feedback" is no longer considered an important aspect as they're more interested in appealing to investor demands (which tends to run counter to user feedback).

Ruqqus is still at the size where it needs feedback and criticism to thrive. Almost every service this size tolerates it, or crumbles over a single controversial moment. And on that note, that little "BETA" is there to remind you that the site is figuring itself out, and I think should be taken as a request to voice your opinions. Its also why I'm critical of some of the exiles and kicks we've seen from official guilds.

Admittedly, what *isn't* normal for a service of this size is how divided the community is on feedback, to the point it feels like combating factions.

parent.body:
As someone who barely cares, the complaints seem valid enough to me.
It was obvious that a new centralized platform has no real way to end differently.

Reddit was founded by hard core libertarian free speech types, and one was arkancided for not selling out, the rest sold out for commie bank money. Reddit fought to be a place for free speech far longer than could have been expected, and normally the selling out to becoming a propaganda outlet happens, much sooner. Ruqqus is showing the signs that they are on that track, and its understandable why. The pressures are very high, and if you refuse to play ball you could seriously end up dead.

People who demand absolutely pure and unimpinged free speech will have to hop from place to place, until there is a suitable decentralized peer-to-peer forum system. And yes, it will no more be able to ban political wrong think than it will pirated content or illegal depraved porn types. 
We will end up there eventually; its just the nature of the tech. Cryptography and the internet are the fundamental winds here, and they are biased towards unstoppable free speech. Sooner or later it will win out, like entropy.

The day will come when the only filters will be the ones you choose to impose on your own. But ruqqus isnt going to be that, it cant be, because it is centralized. Because there are people who pay the bills, people who can be bought or killed.

body:
>illegal depraved porn types

That's probably the one thing that I really, truly can't tolerate stumbling upon. 

When I was younger, I had a pregnancy scare. I was pretty distraught over it and needed advice. I tried to get some perspective on the situation, but I wasn't comfortable talking to anyone I knew, so I made a post on a forum. 

Everyone basically told me that since I wasn't in a position to raise a baby on my own, I needed to get an abortion. When I told them that I was anti-abortion/not comfortable with getting an abortion, they started filling the thread with images of aborted fetuses, mutilated babies and a guy eating baby parts. 

Normally, that would be grotesque and disheartening to see, but because I thought I was pregnant and my hormones were messed up, it really really fucked with me. I don't know how to explain it. It was like a involuntarily saw a cursed image that would bring some sort of evil on me. I messed with me for a while.

I don't want to have to go through stuff like that at random. I don't want to randomly stumble upon CP. I used to be into gore, but now that I'm older and in a less safe environment, I really don't want to see people being maimed and murdered randomly.

If I had to choose between the old style forums or a completely sterilized, PC platform like Reddit or Facebook, I'd choose occasional surprise gore, but I don't want either of those things. I don't want totalitarianism or anarchy. I just want a place where people can freely exchange ideas and information while having a basic sense that they don't have to worry about direct real-life consequences such as doxing, CP or links to other illegal content.

parent.body:
>illegal depraved porn types

That's probably the one thing that I really, truly can't tolerate stumbling upon. 

When I was younger, I had a pregnancy scare. I was pretty distraught over it and needed advice. I tried to get some perspective on the situation, but I wasn't comfortable talking to anyone I knew, so I made a post on a forum. 

Everyone basically told me that since I wasn't in a position to raise a baby on my own, I needed to get an abortion. When I told them that I was anti-abortion/not comfortable with getting an abortion, they started filling the thread with images of aborted fetuses, mutilated babies and a guy eating baby parts. 

Normally, that would be grotesque and disheartening to see, but because I thought I was pregnant and my hormones were messed up, it really really fucked with me. I don't know how to explain it. It was like a involuntarily saw a cursed image that would bring some sort of evil on me. I messed with me for a while.

I don't want to have to go through stuff like that at random. I don't want to randomly stumble upon CP. I used to be into gore, but now that I'm older and in a less safe environment, I really don't want to see people being maimed and murdered randomly.

If I had to choose between the old style forums or a completely sterilized, PC platform like Reddit or Facebook, I'd choose occasional surprise gore, but I don't want either of those things. I don't want totalitarianism or anarchy. I just want a place where people can freely exchange ideas and information while having a basic sense that they don't have to worry about direct real-life consequences such as doxing, CP or links to other illegal content.

body:
You're right. I really don't think there's any reasonable way to guarantee that you won't randomly stumble upon that stuff. 

All that can be done is categorization to some degree and just enough moderation to ensure that action is taken when that category is deliberately ignored and proper punishment when a user submits illegal and harmful content.

As far as hurt feelings go, that should never be taken into account at all. Your feelings are your responsibility. Harassment and realistic threats would be the only feelings related issue to be enforced. Of course that's fairly easy to deal with via a block function, but some people still complain about that.

The aim should mainly be to create a platform that's free, but functional. There has to be enough order to be able to find and share the appropriate content. It's all an interesting experimental process, and I'm enjoying the ride.

I don't want to have to go through stuff like that at random. I don't want to randomly stumble upon CP. I used to be into gore, but now that I'm older and in a less safe environment, I really don't want to see people being maimed and murdered randomly.

If I had to choose between the old style forums or a completely sterilized, PC platform like Reddit or Facebook, I'd choose occasional surprise gore, but I don't want either of those things. I don't want totalitarianism or anarchy. I just want a place where people can freely exchange ideas and information while having a basic sense that they don't have to worry about direct real-life consequences such as doxing, CP or links to other illegal content.

post.body: I simply cannot imagine having the massive temper tantrum as has happened here not result in bans. In fact, if this was any other website, this insanity would have been chucked into the bin two days ago or even a week ago. I applaud the admins for their astounding level of patience it has taken to attempt to reason with these, in all likelihood, teenagers who have never been disciplined before. Thank you for creating a great platform where all can say something, but not everyone has to listen!

parent.body:
>illegal depraved porn types

That's probably the one thing that I really, truly can't tolerate stumbling upon. 

When I was younger, I had a pregnancy scare. I was pretty distraught over it and needed advice. I tried to get some perspective on the situation, but I wasn't comfortable talking to anyone I knew, so I made a post on a forum. 

Everyone basically told me that since I wasn't in a position to raise a baby on my own, I needed to get an abortion. When I told them that I was anti-abortion/not comfortable with getting an abortion, they started filling the thread with images of aborted fetuses, mutilated babies and a guy eating baby parts. 

Normally, that would be grotesque and disheartening to see, but because I thought I was pregnant and my hormones were messed up, it really really fucked with me. I don't know how to explain it. It was like a involuntarily saw a cursed image that would bring some sort of evil on me. I messed with me for a while.
